reviewText:
I've played the PC ports of this NBA2K series since 2K11. To me, 2K12 was the peak of the series so far. This year though, it seems like they're taking advantage of no competition and are taking it easy. Why?

- Players feel much less flexible/agile than in previous years
- They changed the controls, again. 2k13 probably had the best gamepad config to date
- Players are much more sloppy with regards to ball handling. Rebounds go through their hands, silly collisions cause players to lose the ball, sometimes players will randomly animate in ways not appropriate to the situation (sometime causing out of bounds calls)
- Inexplicably consistent blowing layups and dunks, sometimes with completely clear path
- Physics sometimes act weird. Going for a steal sometimes you'll knock the ball out the other side of the court or even into the crowd. This has an unintended funny side effect of making some blocks look way more spectacular than they should be

Still, even having said that laundry list of things that bother me, I'd recommend the game (unless you want to manually patch the new rosters into 2K13). I'm hoping we get a mid-season patch like we did last year to fix these annoyances.

These opinions only cover single player mode.

reviewText:
After playing this game for more or less 50 hours, I have come to these conclusions.

2K has done a TERRIBLE job on their PC port of NBA 2K14. Though I know this may not be the next-gen port, this game still does not meet my personal expectations and feels worse as compared to previous titles and years of the NBA2K franchise.

Over the course of my playing time, I have experienced many frustrating issues with the game. Here are some of the examples.
1. Player stats are not consistent. How is it that MyPlayer, who has maxed out his stats, miss a wide open 3-point shot with no defenders, with the shot feedback showing A+ on Shot Selection and Excellent on Release? I dont know either. This major issue happens too often that I have resorted to give up on shooting the ball, and drive it in instead.

2. Opponents are too over-powered. Though this may sound like I'm a ♥♥♥♥♥, or suck at the game, but this is a major issue that I've felt playing NBA 2K14. The opposing team seems to have stats that are not accurate to their real-life counter-parts. How is it that a CENTER is able to intercept my bounce pass when he is not quick enough to react to it? Do you really think every player is aware of a pass and is able to react to it quickly enough to steal it? I don't think so. I have experienced countless possessions that ended up in turnovers because of the over-powered oppenents.
Another stat issue is with the speed. Do you really think that a center can outrun me? A 6'8 SF with 90 speed? Yeah, of course he can! (sarcasm)
The stats in the game are not realistic, and it gives players abilities they do not possess.

3. There seems to be an issue with ball control. For some reason, MyPlayer, who has maxed out his dribble attributes, can't keep the ball in his hands without having to pass it to some other player. Even with my stats maxed, there seems to be a way for my opponents to take the ball for me. No wonder I average 4 turnovers a game.

4. Association mode is terrible. That's just to make it simple. There seems to be no way for me to get a good running team that has over 80% of team chemistry without making one of the players the STAR role that they want, even if they don't perform like a star. I had a bench player who averages 2ppg asking for a starting spot. Really now? Like that's going to happen.

5. Too many false goaltending calls! I'm so ♥♥♥♥♥♥ that 2K has made the goaltending calls more sensitive. I have been called for goaltending, even though I know for a fact that it is a clean and legit block. DUMB ♥♥♥ REFS!

6. Online is ♥♥♥♥.


I sadly regret getting this game for its full-price of $29.99. This game shouldn't even be worth $5. Terrible job 2K, if only ya'll cared about the PC players, then maybe more people will buy it.

I would definitely NOT RECOMMEND this game.

I'm still going to play it though since it's the newest 2K title.

Hope I don't break my keyboard.

As a Bball lover and player this game is close to my heart and I play it often even after owning it for close to a year already.

Yes it has its glitches and the Dev team is very slack with patches as they were with previous editions also, but it is still the best Bball sim out there.

If you want to feel like an NBA player or the next closest thing then this game is for you, passers by will and have mistaken it for a LIVE broadcast of the NBA, it is so well designed that you will forget the weak points.

These weak points are a very clunky reaction time, I play ball and have never had to run all the way to halfcourt when unsuccessfully trying a steal from the top of the key or miss open layups at the hoop... Also the Ai forces your team to play badly often during the 4th quarter if you are ahead by a reasonable amount but these points were present in earlier versions also so no big surprise there.

If the Dev team spends more time on testing and bug hunting as well as alters the movements so you don't feel like you are punished for attempting a steal for eg. then this could be GOLD, similar to what they have done with the shot blocking in this relaease which in my view is a huge step in the right direction.

The Saga of Adam Smith; Rise & Fall

Adam started his career in Atlanta as an ambitious PG looking to take the league by storm. The league was hit by a force of nature no analyst could have ever predicted. Smith destroyed rookie records for scoring and steals, these feats garnered him Rookie of the Year honors but unfortunately his incredible run was stopped by The Big 3 in the Easten Conference Finals. Adam had always aspired to play in the Big D and requested a transfer. Little did he know that he wasn't the only acquisition the Mavericks would make that offseason. Dallas had managed to acquire Lebron James and Smith in a 3 team trade involving Dallas, Miami, and Atlanta. Smith's second year was almost better than his first; in fact it was statistically better but the spotlight had been shifted. Smith finished 2nd in MVP voting to his colleague James. The Mavericks did manage to land the franchises second championship, a fabulous concession. Smith would learn to love this series of events as four seasons passed, each with a similar storyline. He was a valuable asset to the team but he could never quite keep the spotlight. Two more championships, top five in MVP voting for each of those four seasons. His seventh season was the breakout season he was looking for; he made it a mission to finally be the MVP. This was a contract year, he needed to perform. He was the league top scorer that season; in fact he had outscored the entire rest of his team combined. Smith finished with an outstanding 50+ points/game average and a career low in assists. The Mavericks finished ninth in the West barely missing the playoffs; but he had done it. Smith was the MVP. The administration was not happy with his selfish play and the decline in the team's performance and quickly dealt him away to the Pelicans on a max guaranteed contract. Smith was the star, the golden boy of basketball at last. The glory was lost even faster than it was earned after three pitiful seasons in New Orleans. Many insiders blame the fall on addiction and questionable off-the-court decisions. Smith chose to retire after his contract ended that season. Methamphetamine had utterly consumed the future hall of fame candidate; all of us wish Adam 'The Maverick' Smith the best and truly hope he can turn his life around. It is possible he may have another MVP season in him.

Horrible horrible horrible game, built for frustration and not much fun to be had.  The controls are abysmal, they are on the level of the worst play controls for any game I've ever played.  Trying to control your players is like trying to control someone with a 2 second reaction time on the slickest of ice.  Nothing makes intuitive sense in this game AT ALL.  From the times you will press the pass button and instead of passing to the most obvious wide open player in front of you, it throws it across the court to a guy in double coverage, to the times when your guy is tripping over his own feet for 3+ seconds while you are unable to pass it to the painfully wide open guy - this game is just awful.

Running a play from the play book is comical, good luck trying to execute any of that in a timely fashion.  The game doesn't even feel finished - and it's like the 10th incarnation of this trash so there's absolutely zero excuse.

The MyCareer mode is a complete joke.  Playing offense is atrocious enough with your completely gimped player, but defense is just beyond believable.  How do people put up with this ♥♥♥♥?  I guess I forget the demographic that typically gets sold on this game hasn't necessarily seen a good game before to know how comparitively awful of an experience this game provides compared to even the most mediocre of games out there. I played a lot of this game after my friends and I had a season/draft.  If you enjoy basketball games you will enjoy this for the most part.  There are some goofy things about the game.

The hall of fame doesn't adjust for shortening the game clock.  No one on my team would be able to make the hall of fame because of this.  Disappointed even when I had a scoring or rebound leader for multiple seasons.
The on ball defense is a full motion that needs to play out, so if your player is near the sideline and this happens there is no chance to jump throw or stop moving before going out of bounds.  This only happens 2/3 times in a 3 minute quarter game.  Not the worst but semi-frustrating.

The gui is fine, and the depth of the franchise mode is fun.  Drafting and scouting was fun while trying to manage what oldies i should keep.

This game is beyond ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, i suggest people to overlook the game until they improve many aspects of it.
PROS: It has good visuals. The game looks beautiful despite its many shortcomings (look cons section). Myplayer mode lets you play the game using a custom player, pretty good to immerse yourself in the game, but this mode has its flaws.
CONS: Player models look funny, since the game uses the same engine as its previous iteration. The next gen graphic is only available on console, pretty stupid move 2K. Myplayer mode still lacks immersion, the better mode is only available in Xbone and PS4, way to discriminate your user base 2K. The AI teammates in Myplayer mode is beyond useless. They can't defend, leaving you to do a lot of the defense yourself sometimes to no avail. They miss wide open shot, sometimes they dont even take wide open shot, they can't run fast break often time running themselves out of bound. The AI opponent in Myplayer mode however can be godlike adding to your frustration. They can ignore your defense and put the ball pass it by forcing their way to it, their 3 points ability is beyond ludicrous, 4/6 3pt FG attempt per quarter is common. So you have to REALLY enjoy MyPlayer mode to get past these obvious flaws.
EDIT: I can't take it anymore. The teammates AI is beyond useless. 2 consecutive out of bounds when you passed to them. These are supposedly world class players in KD and Westbrook. They can't defend if their life depends on it, Ibaka can't receive pass and shoot mid range. Waste of money. Never again 2K.
CONCLUSION: I decided to get the game after playing 2K13 and thought it was awesome. 2K14 isn't awesome. The MyPlayer mode drives you nuts. The only salvation this game has is its good pvp mode.

Being a huge Basketball fan, NBA 2k14 does not let down(my hours dont show how much i play this game, i have a Xbox 360! :). First there is Mycareer. In this mode as you can probably guess. You make your mark in the NBA. Your aim is to be the greatest player in the NBA. It is a very addictive mode that can keep you playing for hours. You can also buy shoes and clothing to dress your created player to look casual or wacky off the court!

Then there is Association mode. You play as the president of basketball operations of any team you choose. From Philly to Washington and even the historical teams the Micheal Jordans Bulls. You can coach your team, trade players, play as your team, set practices for your team ect. It also simulates games and generates rookies so your mode can go on for years and years and years, without a single current NBA player because all players eventually retire.

After that  is Lebrons Path to Greatness mode. To be honest, i really dont play this mode because all you really do is simulate LeBron James career ( i would play all the time if it was Carmelo Anthony though!!!!!! :) So if you a fan of LeBron James, this mode is for you.

Last but certainly not least is My Team. Again i dont play this mode a lot, but it is basically a player market. You can have any player current or old, on the same team. The catch is you have to buy them. There are also tournaments and just quick matches to play with the players you have on your team. I guess you can say it is kind of like fantasy basketball in a way.

If you can tolerate it that far then you have to deal with the incredible difficulty and slow process of leveling up your character so he doesn't crap away his career. Sports games usually don't translate well when they are ported to pc. Generally speaking there are often graphics issues, framerate problems, missing features, and endless bugs.

I'm happy to say that NBA 2K14 runs quite well on my laptop and it feels about as smooth and fleshed out as the Xbox 360 and PS3 versions. The game is well optimized and is only missing some superflous mode that I didn't even realize was gone. Exhibition, Association, MyCareer, and Season mode are all intact and that's really all that most people need.

The online support does lag quite a bit but I'm not entirely sure if the problem is from my own ISP or the game's servers. What I do know is that the online multiplayer just doesn't run very well.

Also, a gamepad or controller is absolutely necessary for this. The game does not play nice with mouse/keyboard. I'm sure that it's possible to play without a controller but it's going to be tough. I had trouble just navigating the menus without a controller.

NBA 24K14 is as fun as any other 2K basketball game in recent years. The game modes are almost entirely the same as 2K13, as is pretty much everything else. This is a reluctant recommendation. There isn't a better basketball game available at the moment, so while I have my reservations sending someone else to this title it's not like there's something better I can promote. Generally speaking, since I love baskebtall, I'd really like any game developer to produce a flawless title. Apparently that can't be done, so this is what we get. Will you enjoy it? Here's what I've seen:

The refs barely call charges, even when they should. They instead call blocking fouls against defenders who aren't moving. That's not how the rule works. You can, however, fall down on defense by double-tapping B. I don't know why this option exists.

Your AI teammates: 1) don't recognize iso situations, so they often crowd the lane and fail to drag their defenders away from your attack. 2) don't set picks if not prompted by your controller. 3) have trouble effectively performing basic pick and roll offenses. 4) Never throw alley-oops if not prompted, and barely throw alley-oops when prompted. In a nutshell, you have to ask for everything to happen in a MyPlayer / Player Lock situation, and it's luck of the draw as to whether any of it goes down how you envision it.

The AI defense always favors your player, regardless of his position on the court, possession of the ball, skill level / ability, etc. This likely was implemented to make up for 2K13's lack of intensity, which allowed perimeter shooters to sprint side to side to nail open 3s. Consequently, you couldn't get a back door alley oop opportunity in this game even if it was possible to make your teammates perform one, because you're never forgotten by the defense. This doesn't hold true for your team when it plays defense, however, as opponent alley-oops are frequent.

Your ability to perform putback dunks are nearly nonexistent. Over 100+ hours with a 7'2 Griffin/Shaq hybrid in MyPlayer mode and I have 0 putback dunks. But I have seen the AI perform them
